I'm glad to hear that your new phone case is serving you well! However, I'd be happy to help you with your battery life issues. Here are some tips to help you extend your phone's battery life:

1. **Adjust your screen brightness**: Lowering the screen brightness can significantly reduce battery consumption. You can do this by going to your phone's settings, then display, and adjusting the brightness slider.
2. **Turn off location services**: Location services can quickly drain your battery. Turn off location services for apps that don't need them, and consider turning off GPS when not in use.
3. **Use power-saving mode**: Most phones have a built-in power-saving mode that can help extend battery life. This mode can limit background data usage, reduce screen brightness, and turn off unnecessary features.
4. **Close unused apps**: Closing unused apps can help conserve battery life. Many apps continue to run in the background and consume battery power even when you're not using them.
5. **Turn off Bluetooth and Wi-Fi when not in use**: Bluetooth and Wi-Fi can quickly drain your battery. Turn them off when not in use to conserve power.
6. **Update your operating system**: Keeping your operating system up to date can help improve battery life. Updates often include bug fixes and performance improvements that can help extend battery life.
7. **Avoid extreme temperatures**: Extreme temperatures can affect your battery's performance and lifespan. Avoid leaving your phone in a hot car or in freezing temperatures.
8. **Charge your phone correctly**: Avoid overcharging your phone, as this can reduce the battery's lifespan. Try to keep your phone charged between 20% and 80% if possible.
9. **Use a battery-saving app**: There are many battery-saving apps available that can help extend battery life. These apps can identify power-hungry apps, turn off unnecessary features, and provide personalized recommendations for improving battery life.
10. **Consider replacing your battery (if possible)**: If your phone's battery is old or damaged, it may be causing battery life issues. If possible, consider replacing the battery or having it professionally replaced.

I hope these tips help you extend your phone's battery life!
